nodes.bodyText: This method can be used outside of installer. For helm, I need to execute a command. Can you move these methods to a common class.
will do.
I'll move it to a common class under actions.impl. will that work for you?
done. Added new common class is ActionImplCommon.java.
@vanajamukkara ^^^
include messages on asserts, so if they fail we get a descriptive message
will do
done

maybe these should just be defaults?
we could have a defaults() method on WITParams to set these? @rjeberhard what do you think?
Makes sense to me, and would make these a little less verbose and easier to read.
I have made the changes locally, and the code looks much better. Thanks.

I also moved the constants in WebLogicImageTool into WITParams. I like it.
The only thing that I don't like is that the test code still refers to the impl class WITParams. We'll have to introduce an interface to avoid that. Shall I do that? or any other suggestions?
@ddsharpe suggested a withWITParams() or something like that, which can be static imported, and returns an instance, so you don't need to write/init the class name....
Let me explore more. thanks.
I got something working:). Will push soon.
done
made one more change for this. I am happy now:).
will do
done

don't just swallow the exception.
at least log it
will do
done - added a warning log message.
improve doc

nodes.bodyText: i would prefer that tests just assume it is there and use it -- let the impl worry about whether or not it needs to download it under the covers
I'll make the change.

The original thinking was that we'll have a place does all prerequisites. The code of downloading WIT/WDT will be moved to that place once we have it. The download code here just demonstrates how to do it.

I can add a comment to indicate that, if that's okay with you.
Otherwise I'll move it into the impl class and remove the static access methods in TestActions. We'll have to add them back to TestActions when we have an action that does all prerequisites.
use //
This comment does not exist any more in the latest.
is this unfinished? does not seem to do anything
it creates a MII image using the default values. I am working on adding more contents into the image; will be in a different PR.
ok fair enough
don't think we need javadoc for the constructor, it's pretty clear what it does
Good catch! The class was copied from existing integration tests. I removed the comment.
